cards.title: Tennis / Djokovic and Federer speak after the Wimbledon final
cards.rawTitle: Djokovic and Federer speak after the Wimbledon final

item.title: Victorious Djokovic and runner-up Federer speak after 2015 Wimbledon final
item.trailText: Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer speak after their 2015 Wimbledon final which saw Djokovic beat the 33-year-old Swiss in four sets
item.standFirst: Novak Djokovic and Roger Federer speak after their 2015 Wimbledon final which saw Djokovic beat the 33-year-old Swiss in four sets. In a match split between dry and rain-threatened, the world's best player wore down the world's favourite player 7-6, 6-7, 6-4, 6-3. Despite a sparkling performance at times, a dejected Federer said afterwards: 'It's no fun ever losing'

stillImage.caption: Reaction after Novak Djokovic beat Roger Federer to win te men's singles final at Wimbledon on Sunday. 13 July 2015 Photograph: SNTV Photograph: SNTV

cards.title: Real Madrid / Casillas bids emotional farewell to Real
cards.rawTitle: Casillas bids emotional farewell to Real

item.title: Iker Casillas bids emotional farewell to Real Madrid
item.trailText: A very emotional and teary Iker Casillas struggles to speak at a press conference after formally announcing his departure from Real Madrid
item.standFirst: A very emotional and teary Iker Casillas struggles to speak at a press conference after formally announcing his departure from Real Madrid. The goalkeeper, who has been with the Spanish club for 25 years, confirms his move to Porto, saying it's a difficult day in his career. Casillas won 19 trophies for Madrid, including three Uefa Champions League titles and five La Liga crowns

cards.title: Tour de France 2015 / Stages eight and nine

item.title: Tour de France, stages eight and nine
item.trailText: We round up the best photos from the weekend, and stages eight and nine. Stage eight saw Chris Froome in the yellow jersey, leading the pack on the final climb, but beaten by AG2R’s rider Alexis Vuillermoz and Peter Sagan regaining the green jersey. Stage nine was the team time trial, won by BCM, only one second in front of Team Sky
item.standFirst: We round up the best photos from the weekend, and stages eight and nine. Stage eight saw Chris Froome in the yellow jersey, leading the pack on the final climb, but beaten by AG2R’s rider Alexis Vuillermoz and Peter Sagan regaining the green jersey. Stage nine was the team time trial, won by BCM, only one second in front of Team Sky

cards.title: MLS / Gerrard's LA Galaxy debut praised by Arena
cards.rawTitle: Gerrard's LA Galaxy debut praised by Arena

item.title: Steven Gerrard's LA Galaxy debut praised by Bruce Arena
item.trailText: LA Galaxy manager Bruce Arena says Steven Gerrard looked like he belonged in LA Galaxy after the midfielder made his debut for the MLS club on Saturday
item.standFirst: LA Galaxy manager Bruce Arena says Steven Gerrard looked like he belonged in LA Galaxy after the midfielder made his debut for the MLS club on Saturday. The former Liverpool and England captain played the first 45 minutes of his side's pre-season International Champions Cup game against Club América. Galaxy won the fixture 2-1

cards.title: Ashes 2015 / England are a dangerous side, says Cook after Australia victory
cards.rawTitle: England are a dangerous side, says Cook after Australia victory

item.title: Ashes 2015: England are a dangerous side, says Cook after Australia victory
item.trailText: Alastair Cook says it was important for his side to prove they can play well against Australia, as England won Ashes opener in Cardiff on Saturday
item.standFirst: Alastair Cook says it was important for his side to prove they can play well against Australia, as England won Ashes opener in Cardiff on Saturday. England defeated the Aussies by 169 runs. Cook praises his team's performance but says he is certain Australia will bounce back. The two teams will clash again on Thursday at Lord's

cards.title: Tour de France / Stage eight highlights as Vuillermoz sprints to win
cards.rawTitle: Stage eight highlights as Vuillermoz sprints to win

item.title: Tour de France 2015: stage eight highlights
item.trailText: Alexis Vuillermoz of France stunned the favourites by sprinting to victory at the summit of Mûr de Bretagne to claim stage eight
item.standFirst: Alexis Vuillermoz of France stunned the favourites by sprinting to victory at the summit of Mûr de Bretagne to claim stage eight. Slovakia's Peter Sagan crossed the line in fourth, which was enough to earn him the green jersey of the German André Greipel, while Britain's Chris Froome stays in yellow ahead of the team time trial

cards.title: In pictures / The best images from Hereford FC's first game at Edgar Street
cards.rawTitle: The best images from Hereford FC's first game at Edgar Street

item.title: Hereford FC's historic first game at Edgar Street
item.trailText: The new Hereford Football Club was born with a friendly against FC United of Manchester. Photographer Andy Hall went along to illustrate the historic match
item.standFirst: The new Hereford Football Club, founded by supporters after their beloved, historic Hereford United crumpled into liquidation last year, has been reborn and took on FC United of Manchester in a friendly, their first at Edgar Street. Observer photographer Andy Hall joined the 4000+ crowd at the historic match
